summary: An FBI email from October 21, 2019, detailing investigative findings related to Ghislaine Maxwell's cell phone number. It reveals the number was associated with a UPS store address in Boston, was called the day after Jeffrey Epstein's arrest, and was linked to Maxwell's company Terramar Project, Inc. The email also notes the number was saved in Epstein's phone under the name 'Ghislaine'.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The email is focused on her cell phone number, its association with a UPS store address and her company Terramar Project, Inc., and its presence in Jeffrey Epstein's phone.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned in relation to his arrest; his seized cell phone contained Maxwell's number saved under the name 'Ghislaine'.

connections.description: Maxwell's cell phone number was saved in Epstein's seized phone under the name 'Ghislaine', indicating direct contact.

events.title: Epstein's arrest
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was arrested. The email notes Maxwell's cell number was called the day after this arrest.

locations: UPS store (at 139A Charles Street, Boston, Massachusetts)
keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell's cell phone number was associated with a UPS store at 139A Charles Street, Boston, MA, where an employee provided it as a contact for her.
The phone number was called the day after Jeffrey Epstein's arrest in an attempt to contact Maxwell.
Subscriber information for the number traced back to 'Terramar Project, Inc.', a company owned by Maxwell and associated with the Boston address.

In Epstein's cell phone, seized on the day of his arrest, this number was saved under the name 'Ghislaine' with the label 'Mobile'; his phone also contained two other numbers for her labeled 'Home' and 'Work'.
The communication is an FBI email detailing investigative steps to locate and contact Maxwell following Epstein's arrest.
